name: fwdform
tagline: Quickstart contact form processing for static sites
body:
Quickstart contact form processing ---------------------------------- This will be useful if... * You want to forward a simple contact form to your email * You have a (S3) static site and don't want to run a server Usage ----- Register your email: ```bash $ curl --data "email=" https://fwdform.herokuapp.com/register Token: 780a8c9b-dc2d-4258-83af-4deefe446dee ``` Test (optional): ```bash $ curl --data "email=person@form.com&name=person&message=hello" \ https://fwdform.herokuapp.com/user/ ``` Put into action: ```html
Email:
Name:
Message:
``` NB: Required parameters are: `email`, `name` and `message`. Other parameters will be ignored. Privacy concerns? ----------------- Spin up your own free [Heroku](http://www.heroku.com) instance. A [Mandrill](http://mandrill.com) account required for email delivery. ```bash $ git clone https://github.com/samdobson/fwdform.git $ heroku create $ heroku config:set MANDRILL_API_KEY= $ heroku addons:add heroku-postgresql:dev $ heroku pg:promote HEROKU_POSTGRESQL_COLOR $ heroku ps:scale web=1 ```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
